title: Window Off-Screen or Partially Visible
content:
## Symptom

Application is running (visible in taskbar or system tray), but the main window is not visible on screen.

**Common scenarios:**
- Window completely invisible
- Window partially visible (edge off-screen)
- Window shows on second monitor that's now disconnected
- Title bar off-screen, cannot move window

## Common Causes

**Monitor configuration changes:**
- Disconnected external monitor (window was on that monitor)
- Changed from docking station to laptop screen
- Changed from dual monitor to single monitor
- Swapped primary/secondary monitor

**Display settings changes:**
- Changed screen resolution
- Changed DPI scaling
- Rotated display orientation

**Window position saved incorrectly:**
- Application crashed while window off-screen
- Manually dragged window off-screen
- Multi-monitor setup changed

## Quick Fix: Reset Window Position

**Method 1: Using Settings (Easiest)**

1. Right-click system tray icon ðŸ“½ï¸
2. Select **Settings**
3. Enter admin password
4. Go to **Diagnostics** tab
5. Click **Reset Window Position**
6. Window will appear centered on primary monitor

**Method 2: Using Keyboard (If can't access Settings)**

1. Click application icon in taskbar to select it
2. Press `Alt+Space` (opens window menu)
3. Press `M` (Move command)
4. Press any arrow key (Left, Right, Up, or Down)
5. Move mouse (window will follow cursor)
6. Click when window is in desired position
7. OR press `Enter` to place window at current position

**Method 3: Maximize Window**

1. Click application icon in taskbar
2. Press `Windows+Up Arrow` (maximize window)
3. Window will maximize on current monitor
4. Press `Windows+Down Arrow` to restore (now visible)

## Manual Window Positioning

**If window is partially visible:**

1. Click and drag the visible portion
2. Move window to center of screen
3. If title bar is off-screen:
   - Use `Alt+Space` then `M` method (see above)
   - OR maximize then restore

## Preventing Future Issues

**Best practices for laptop users:**

1. **Before disconnecting external monitor:**
   - Drag window to laptop screen
   - Close window while on laptop screen
   - OR minimize to system tray

2. **Configure for laptop screen:**
   - When using laptop screen only
   - Resize window to fit laptop screen
   - Position in comfortable location
   - This position will be saved

3. **Use system tray:**
   - Minimize to system tray instead of closing
   - Double-click tray icon to restore
   - Window appears on current active monitor

**For multi-monitor setups:**

1. **Choose primary monitor:**
   - Decide which monitor is "home" for app
   - Keep window there most of the time
   - Application remembers last position

2. **Test before disconnecting:**
   - Move window to monitor that stays connected
   - Ensure title bar visible
   - Close or minimize before disconnecting

## Advanced: Manual Configuration File Edit

**Only if other methods fail:**

1. Close application completely
2. Navigate to: `%APPDATA%\ProjectorControl\`
3. Find settings file (e.g., `settings.db` or `window_positions.json`)
4. Delete the file (or rename for backup)
5. Restart application
6. Window will appear at default position (centered)

**âš  Warning:** This may reset other window preferences.

## Understanding Window Memory

The application saves:
- Last window position (X, Y coordinates)
- Last window size (Width, Height)
- Last monitor (which screen it was on)
- Maximized/minimized state

When a saved monitor no longer exists:
- Windows may place window off-screen
- Application tries to restore to same position
- But that position is now invalid

## Testing After Fix

**Verify window is working:**

1. Move window to different positions
2. Resize window
3. Close and reopen
4. Should reappear at last position

**Test multi-monitor scenario:**

1. Connect external monitor
2. Move window to external monitor
3. Disconnect external monitor
4. Window should move to laptop screen automatically
   - If not, use Reset Window Position

## When to Contact IT

- Reset Window Position button not available
- Keyboard methods don't work
- Window still invisible after reset
- Problem persists across reinstalls
- Multi-monitor behavior is broken

## Related Windows Features

**Windows built-in window management:**
- `Windows+Shift+Left/Right` - Move window between monitors
- `Windows+D` - Show desktop (minimize all)
- `Alt+Tab` - Switch between windows
- `Windows+Tab` - Task view (see all windows)

> **Tip:** Use the keyboard method (Alt+Space, M) to move an off-screen window back to view. This works with any Windows application, not just this one.
